verifier_notes: All three baseline groups from SPECIFICATION_SURFACE.json are present in specification_results.csv. No baseline group reassignments were made. All 69 rows executed successfully (run_success=1). Two near-duplicate pairs flagged in G2: rc/sample/restrict_conflict_only == baseline__tablec1_col1 and rc/sample/restrict_noconflict_only == baseline__tablec1_col2 (identical estimates) -- these are structurally expected since the baselines are defined on those exact subsamples. All rows use canonical inference infer/se/hc/hc3.
global_notes: No baseline group reassignments relative to the surface. G3 p-values appear as machine epsilon (e.g., 5.77e-15) rather than exact zero due to floating-point precision in statsmodels/pyfixest HC3 computation -- these are valid and indicate highly significant effects. Design-level specs (G1 diff_in_means, with_covariates) use N=5915 vs baseline col3 N=5908, reflecting a slightly different sample filter (design specs appear to use the unfiltered Choice sample while baselines use Highx10==0 & Highx100==0 restriction); this is a minor scope difference within the same claim object and does not invalidate core status. Inference variants (infer/se/hc/hc1, infer/se/hc/hc2) correctly appear only in inference_results.csv (15 rows: G1x2 variants x 3 baselines = 6, G2x2 variants x 3 baselines = 6, G3x1 variant x 3 baselines = 3).

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Effect of advisor preference to see incentive first (choicebefore) on probability of recommending incentivized product (recommendincentive), in Choice experiment (ITT), baseline stakes only (Highx10==0 & Highx100==0)
baseline_groups.treatment_concept: Preference for seeing incentive information first (choicebefore)
baseline_groups.target_population: Choice experiment participants, baseline stakes, CloudResearch/Prolific/MTurk
baseline_groups.expected_sign_rationale: Authors find choicebefore positive and significant in Table 3 Col 1 (getyourchoice==1 subsample), indicating advisors who prefer to see incentive first are more likely to recommend the incentivized product
baseline_groups.notes: All 3 surface baseline specs executed and match expected outcome/treatment variables. RC specs fully cover the surface plan (all 24 rc_spec_ids executed). Two design alternatives (diff_in_means, with_covariates) use N=5915 vs baseline col3 N=5908 -- minor scope difference consistent with slightly different sample filter in design specs.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Effect of random assignment to see incentive first (seeincentivefirst) on probability of recommending incentivized product (recommendincentive), in NoChoice experiment (ITT), attentive participants only
baseline_groups.treatment_concept: Randomly assigned to see incentive information first (seeincentivefirst)
baseline_groups.expected_sign_rationale: Authors find seeincentivefirst positive and significant in conflict subsample (Table C.1 Col 1), consistent with anchoring hypothesis
baseline_groups.notes: All 3 surface baseline specs executed. Two near-duplicate pairs: G2__rc__sample__restrict_conflict_only produces identical estimates to G2__baseline__tablec1_col1 (both use conflict==1 filter); G2__rc__sample__restrict_noconflict_only produces identical estimates to G2__baseline__tablec1_col2 (both use conflict==0 filter). This is structurally expected -- the baselines are defined on those exact subsamples, and the RC sample restrictions replicate them. Not flagged as invalid since the surface explicitly planned both. All 12 rc_spec_ids executed.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Effect of costly-choice treatment conditions (seeincentivecostly) on advisor preference to see incentive first (choicebefore), in Choice experiment, baseline stakes only
baseline_groups.outcome_concept: Advisor prefers to see incentive information first (binary)
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: Average treatment effect of costly-choice on preference for information order, OLS-LPM
baseline_groups.target_population: Choice experiment participants, Highx10==0 & Highx100==0, CloudResearch/Prolific/MTurk
baseline_groups.expected_sign_rationale: Authors find seeincentivecostly negative and significant (Table 2), indicating costly-choice conditions reduce preference for seeing incentive first
baseline_groups.notes: All 3 surface baseline specs executed. G3 p-values are machine epsilon (4-9e-15) rather than exact zero -- valid floating-point behavior for highly significant effects with HC3 SEs. Consistent sign and magnitude across all RC variants confirms robustness. All 18 rc_spec_ids executed. Design alternatives use N=5915 (slightly larger than baseline col1 N=5908) consistent with G1 design spec pattern.
